macro_markets.query: What are the most important macroeconomic and stock market news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major index movements, Fed/central bank news, and significant company earnings or announcements.

items.title: S&P 500 in Freefall Amid Trump-EU Spat Over Greenland at Davos
items.summary: The S&P 500 is experiencing a sharp decline this week, driven by escalating tensions between Trump and the EU over Greenland, dominating discussions at Davos. This geopolitical flashpoint has overshadowed other market trends.

items.title: US Supreme Court Delays Ruling on Trump Tariffs Under Emergency Powers Act
items.summary: The US Supreme Court has postponed its decision on tariffs imposed by the Trump administration using the International Emergency Economic Powers Act. Markets remain resilient despite ongoing geopolitical risks including Greenland, Venezuela, and Iran.

items.title: US Economy Enters 2026 on Strong Footing with Broadening Market Gains
items.summary: Recent data shows the US economy starting 2026 robustly, with global stock markets continuing upward trends supported by strong earnings expectations, stable inflation, and potential Fed easing. Geopolitical worries persist but have not derailed advances.

items.title: Questions Mount Over Federal Reserve Independence Under Trump
items.summary: Investor concerns rise regarding the Federal Reserve's independence, including potential legal challenges against Chair Powell and the implications of his term ending. Precious metals like gold and silver have rallied as safe havens amid tensions.

crypto_news.query: What are the most significant cryptocurrency and blockchain news from the past 24 hours? Include major price movements, regulatory news, and notable project developments.

items.title: Bitcoin Drops Below $90K Amid $708.9M Liquidations
items.summary: Bitcoin fell below $90,000 to a low of $89,162, triggering $708.9 million in crypto liquidations over 24 hours, predominantly long positions at $648.78 million. The RSI hit -33.7, signaling weakening momentum after sustained selling.

items.title: MicroStrategy Becomes First Company to Hold Over 700,000 Bitcoin
items.summary: Michael Saylor's MicroStrategy announced on January 20, 2026, a $2.1 billion purchase making it the first company to hold more than 700,000 Bitcoin.

items.title: Coinbase Withdraws Support for CLARITY Crypto Bill, Delaying Senate Markup
items.summary: Coinbase pulled support from the Senate's CLARITY market structure bill, causing a markup cancellation and uncertainty; a call with stakeholders yielded no progress, with rescheduling possibly in February.

items.title: Bitcoin Slides on Risk-Off Sentiment from Trump Greenland Push
items.summary: Geopolitical tensions escalated as President Trump renewed pressure for U.S. acquisition of Greenland, prompting a risk-off shock that sent Bitcoin sliding while investors flocked to gold and silver.

items.title: Trump's Davos Speech on Jan 21 Expected to Impact Crypto Markets
items.summary: Donald Trump's World Economic Forum speech in Davos on January 21, 2026, is anticipated to address U.S. economic strategies amid crypto regulation tensions, with Coinbase CEO criticizing a proposed bill.

items.title: NYSE Plans Crypto Trading Platform with 24/7 Operations
items.summary: The New York Stock Exchange announced plans for a new crypto platform offering 24/7 operations, instant settlement, stablecoin funding, and multi-chain support, pending regulatory approvals.

items.title: Tornado Cash Used to Launder $282M from Recent Hack
items.summary: Blockchain security firm CertiK revealed on January 18 that Tornado Cash laundered some of the $282 million in Bitcoin stolen in a January 10 wallet compromise, bridged to Ethereum.

ai_news.query: What are the most important artificial intelligence and machine learning news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include new model releases, company announcements, research breakthroughs, and industry trends.

items.title: New AI Method BioPathNet Uncovers Hidden Patterns in Biomedical Knowledge Graphs
items.summary: Researchers at Helmholtz Munich and Mila developed BioPathNet, an interpretable AI tool that searches biological data networks to predict gene functions, disease relationships, cancer therapies, and drug repurposing. The method generates testable hypotheses by tracing paths in knowledge graphs, with applications demonstrated for leukemia, gastric cancer, and Alzheimer's.

items.title: Amazon CEO Andy Jassy Warns AI Bubble Could Pop Amid Massive Compute Investments
items.summary: In an interview, Amazon CEO Andy Jassy acknowledged the possibility of an AI bubble bursting due to high compute demands by AI labs, while defending investments like those with OpenAI on AWS. He highlighted Amazon's custom Trainium chips, AGI organization, and plans to reduce workforce via AI.

items.title: 2026 Consensus: AI Chatbots Trapped in Paradigmatic Box, Scaling Laws Hit Ceiling
items.summary: Experts declare current AI models like GPT-5, Gemini, and Llama stuck in a 'pre-training paradox' reliant on Transformer architecture, struggling with causal reasoning. Shift toward multimodal paradigms and agentic workflows is underway, with calls for new architectures like intrinsically motivated reinforcement learning.

items.title: Emerson Launches Affordable NI PXI Hardware for AI-Enhanced Test Workflows
items.summary: Emerson introduced cost-effective NI PXI products including oscilloscopes, I/O modules, and controllers to broaden access to modular test platforms supporting AI-driven automation, real-time reasoning, and high-density measurements.

gaming.query: What are the most notable video game and gaming industry news from the past 24 hours? Include game releases, announcements, esports, and industry developments.

items.title: Xbox Game Pass Announces Major January 2026 Wave 2 Additions Including Death Stranding Director's Cut
items.summary: Microsoft revealed 10 new games joining Xbox Game Pass from January 21 to February 3, headlined by Death Stranding Director's Cut, Ninja Gaiden: Ragebound, and RoadCraft on January 21. Upcoming titles include Warhammer 40,000: Space Marine 2 on January 29 and The Talos Principle 2 on January 27.

items.title: January 2026 Game Reveals Roundup Features Dozens of New Trailers and Announcements
items.summary: A comprehensive video compilation highlights major January 2026 reveals including Dragon Quest VII Reimagined, Code Vein 2, Pragmata, Warhammer 40,000: Dawn of War IV, and others like Defect, Shadow of the Road, and Aniimo. These announcements cover diverse genres from RPGs to survival games.

items.title: Resident Evil Village and Mio: Memories in Orbit Now Available on Xbox Game Pass
items.summary: Xbox Game Pass added Resident Evil Village and Mio: Memories in Orbit on January 20, setting the stage for further high-profile releases like Death Stranding Director's Cut tomorrow.

items.title: Sea of Thieves Season 18 Act 2 Launches on Xbox Game Pass January 22
items.summary: Sea of Thieves Season 18, Act 2 arrives on Xbox Game Pass for Cloud, PC, and Console on January 22, alongside other additions like Dead by Daylight Stranger Things DLC on January 27.

tech_news.query: What are the most important technology news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major product launches, company news, and significant tech industry developments. Exclude AI-specific news.

items.title: Qualcomm CEO Discusses AI Expansion Beyond Data Centers
items.summary: Qualcomm CEO Cristiano Amon outlined the next phase of AI deployment expanding into cars, devices, and robotics, positioning the company as a unique semiconductor player with diversified AI applications.

items.title: VisionWave Advances Defense Technology Computational Acceleration
items.summary: VisionWave Holdings announced progress on its qSpeed computational acceleration architecture for defense applications including fire control, counter-UAS, and intercept workflows where microseconds matter.

items.title: Elbit Systems Awarded $275 Million Defense Contract
items.summary: Elbit Systems secured approximately $275 million in contracts for advanced airborne electronic warfare and Direct Infra-Red Counter-Measure systems for an Asia-Pacific region customer over 5 years.

items.title: General Dynamics Awarded $988 Million Navy Contract
items.summary: General Dynamics received a $988 million contract to continue modernizing U.S. Navy fleet command and control systems, with a one-year base period and multiple option years.

items.title: Peter Thiel Donates $3 Million Against California Wealth Tax
items.summary: PayPal co-founder Peter Thiel contributed $3 million to oppose California's proposed 5% wealth tax on billionaires, reflecting ongoing concerns among tech leaders about the state's business environment.
